针对影响 7 个 OEM 的 Android 本地海拔漏洞的漏洞发布https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/exploit-released-for-android-local-elevation-flaw-impacting-7-oems/ Wed, 31 Jan 2024 14:15:23 -0500比尔·图拉斯SecurityGoogleMobile https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/exploit-released-for-android-local-elevation-flaw-impacting-7-oems/ A proof-of-concept (PoC) exploit for a local privilege elevation flaw impacting at least seven Android original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) is now publicly available on GitHub. However, as the exploit requires local access, its release will mostly be helpful to researchers. [...]

CISA：供应商必须保护 SOHO 路由器免受 Volt Typhoon 攻击https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/cisa-vendors-must-secure-soho-routers-against-volt-typhoon-attacks/ Wed, 31 Jan 2024 11:14:48 -0500塞尔吉乌·加特兰Securityhttps://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/cisa-vendors-must-secure-soho-routers-against-volt-typhoon-attacks/ CISA has urged manufacturers of small office/home office (SOHO) routers to ensure their devices' security against ongoing attacks attempting to hijack them, especially those coordinated by Chinese state-backed hacking group Volt Typhoon (Bronze Silhouette).
